description.plain:
Russell Vitale is a rapper from Atlanta, Georgia, by way of New Jersey. A lifelong fan of rap, Russ began writing raps in his notebook at the age of 7. At 14, he began making beats, producing for his friend Bugus who had dreams of making it as a rapper. In high school, Russ made the decision to also pursue a career as a rapper himself.

Between 2011 and 2014, Russ released 11 mixtapes. These received minimal attention, and Russ decided to wait to release his debut album until he had enough of an audience. What followed was 96 consecutive weekly singles released to his SoundCloud page. Two notables among the slew of singles were “What They Want” and “Losin Control,” both of which ended up being certified 2x Platinum by the RIAA.

On May 5, 2017, Russ released his debut album There’s Really A Wolf, which spawned 7 singles with Gold certification or higher and was certified Platinum within a year of its release. A year later, his sophomore project ZOO came to be on September 7, 2018, this time opting to enlist external producers and featured artists. Then, at the end of January 2020, he dropped his long-awaited SHAKE THE SNOW GLOBE album, where he talks about love, haters and his wealth.

Nearly every song by Russ is produced, mixed, mastered, engineered, written, and recorded by Russ himself and he renowned his title of being an independent artist. In 2020, he signed away from Columbia Records to fully become independent and declared in an Instagram post his milestone.

songs.title: Losin Control

description.plain:
“Losin Control” is Russ' 49th single of 2015 and was released on November 9th, 2015. It also stands as Russ' most popular R&B performance, proving that he is not only a rapper and producer.

Russ wrote this song for his first girlfriend as an apology. He expressed his motive for creating the song in a tweet that was deleted moments after posting it, he explains:

I’m tryna to empathize that I understand why she’s fighting her feelings

In the first verse, he is actually telling the story of how he neglected his first girlfriend. His first girlfriend is the same girl that he raps about in a song released two months before this one, “First One”; it goes more into depth about the girl, their relationship, and what he did to push away the only girl who genuinely cared for him.

Due to the way Russ treated his ex, she now finds it hard to give her love and trust to another man. In the second verse Russ explains that the new guys intentions were nothing like his were. Even though the new guy is proving to her that he isn’t going to take her love for granted she still battles an internal conflict because of her relationship with Russ.





The official music video was released to YouTube on February 1, 2016. The video is directed by Edgar Esteves and features Russ himself, along with YouTube beauty vlogger Taylor Layne.

songs.title: What They Want

description.plain:
“What They Want” is Russ' 37th single. The song is a response to labels—Russ is saying he’s better off without them. On January 2, 2016, a little over four months after being released, “What They Want” reached its first million plays. People continued to listen and the song grew popularity, making it Russ' first song to reach 3 million plays.

https://twitter.com/russdiemon/status/722234150724452352

On May 3, 2016, the official music video for “What They Want” was released via Russ' YouTube. The video was directed by Edgar Esteves with help from Juanma Sierra. It also gained a spot on World Star Hip Hop a day after its release.

After the release of the music video, the song got recycled and gained more attention. And now the song is quickly reaching 4 million plays on SoundCloud alone. It also got to the “Hot Tracks” section on iTunes on May 6th, among artists like Drake, Migos, Desiigner, and more.

On the 15th of July 2017, Russ posted a video on his twitter and facebook of how he made the beat :

https://twitter.com/russdiemon/status/886072460013129728

songs.full_title: BEST ON EARTH by Russ (Ft. BIA)
songs.title: BEST ON EARTH

description.plain:
Two weeks after “OLD DAYS,” Russ returns with his 11th single of 2019. Backed by production featuring bed squeaks, the raunchy track finds Russ & BIA rapping about the sexual chemistry they have with their lovers.

The song is produced by Boi-1da, making it the fourth Russ single he has produced in 2019. “BEST ON EARTH” also marks Russ and BIA’s first collaboration.

The single was first teased a day prior to its official release when Russ posted a video to Instagram of him listening to the song.

songs.title: Yung God

description.plain:
“Yung God” is the 9th single Russ has released the year of 2016 on March 22nd.

Russ has been dropping only singles since his song “Kiki” was released (October 11th of 2014). This will make his 70th single since “Kiki” was released.

Since his release of his song “Got It Good”(February 1st, 2015) he has not gone one week without releasing a single with the exception of one week where he released a music video for his song “Losin Control” and a week when he was out of town going to Philly, NYC, and other places for shows and to relax with friends. SXSW also held him for a little and when he posted to Instagram about the new song he said:

SXWS was wild. Now back to regularly scheduled programming….yung god



Every song has been produced, written, mixed, mastered, and engineered by Russ himself. Each song has also been free to download and his most popular songs are available to purchase on iTunes.

ALL MUSIC at DIEMON.COM

songs.title: Some Time

description.plain:
“Some Time” exhibits Russ’s feeling of wanting to press pause on his life. The hustle that the music business requires doesn’t allow him to take in many moments by himself.

This was the third release by Russ in just as many weeks to open 2018. It followed “Flip” and “Alone.”

It marks yet another collaboration between Russ and producer Scott Storch, though it is their first collaboration that appears on an album.

songs.title: CIVIL WAR

description.plain:
“Civil War” is Russ’s third single of 2019, following “AINT GOIN BACK” and “All I Want.” It marks his first collaboration with Canadian producer Boi-1da.

The song uses the concept of a “civil war,” an internal conflict between factions of the same nation, as a metaphor for a rough patch in a relationship.

songs.title: September 16

description.plain:
On “September 16,” Russ describes his parents' complicated relationship.

The first verse is from his father Jim’s perspective, and the second verse is from his mother June’s perspective. Russ’s father explains how he feels that he has failed the woman of his dreams and has had to swallow his pride now that his son is his family’s primary breadwinner. However, in the second verse, his wife eases his concerns and explains that she is only so hard on him because she recognizes his potential.

songs.title: Willy Wonka

description.plain:
“Willy Wonka” is the 8th single Russ released in 2015 on March 3rd. The song features two of Russ' friends, Paulina and Jafe. Paulina has previously worked with Russ, being the gypsy and tranquil dancer in his music video for his song “Gypsy”.

The song mentions candy and the hook and title could have been built around one thing:
https://twitter.com/russdiemon/status/296920389194498048

The music video for this was recorded at ©KidSuper Studios in Brooklyn, New York. KidSuper is an idea that came from wanting to relive the life of kid and to bring out the youth all people have in them. Colm is a designer, artist, CEO of KidSuper and is also a close friend to Russ.

songs.title: Psycho

description.plain:
“Psycho” is a love track by Russ containing a melodic sound, where Russ sings how his lover turns him crazy. Interestingly Russ continues the story-line into “Psycho (Pt. 2),” which led into one of his biggest 2016 hits.

This track also opens up with a sample from Bobby Caldwell’s 1978 soul-hit, “What You Won’t Do for Love.”

songs.title: Exposed

description.plain:
“Exposed” is the 20th single Russ released in 2016 on September 7th. This also marks Russ' 81st consecutive single Russ has released since his song “Kiki” in October of 2014.

On “What They Want” Russ declared himself a “DIY pioneer,” detailing his rise from the underground to being signed with Columbia Records.

With this new track, Russ picks at artists who claim to be independent, but are secretly signed to major record labels.

Russ gets aggressive lyrically over a dramatic violin track.

songs.title: Maybe

description.plain:
On “Maybe” Russ goes back in memory lane to a romantic fling he once had.

While the first verse details their relationship and how she eventually moved on from him, the second verse serves as the ultimate flex on an ex. Russ raps circles around his ex, letting her know that he’s been doing good in all aspects of his life. While it seems like she had the upper hand before he made it, “Maybe” sounds like the curve that he’s been waiting to dish out.

Scott Storch uses a climbing xylophone sound with some booming 808’s and a crispy snare that compliments Russ' voice well for the beat.

songs.title: I’m Here

description.plain:
“I’m Here” serves as Russ’s proclamation to the rap game that he has arrived. He confidently takes listeners through his skill set, existing catalog, and the ways in which his life has changed in a short period of time.

The track serves as the intro to his debut album, and along with the outro “MVP,” Russ stated in an interview with Elliott Wilson for the Tidal series Car Test that he wanted people to know that:

There’s four minutes of bars at the top and bottom of the album.

https://youtu.be/5WytXTBUTy0?t=4m38s

songs.title: T-Pain

description.plain:
“T-Pain” is the 2nd single from the How To Rob mixtape, released on August 10th, 2014.

Russ sings over one of T-Pain’s most well-known singles, “Can’t Believe It”. He uses T-Pain’s signature sound, autotune, throughout the entire song. He also decides to keep the very catchy hook.

T-Pain is one of the most well-known R&B artist, who boosted the use of autotune. We all are a fan of his catchy songs he released in the early 2000s. Choosing T-Pain to put on his How To Rob mixtape, shows Russ was influenced by him and appreciates the originality and production brought by the artist.

Full album, listen and download at DIEMON.COM

songs.title: NIGHTTIME (Interlude)

description.plain:
“NIGHTTIME (Interlude)” is the third single off of Russ’s third studio album, SHAKE THE SNOW GLOBE.

The song is about relationship issues that have been building up over time.

Throughout this relationship, there has been a lot of hesitancy to commit to one another and accept their emotions. However, at night it feels like nothing is held back and they are able to put their doubts aside and fully experience each other.

songs.full_title: Moonlight In Atlanta by Russ (Ft. Russ)
songs.title: Moonlight In Atlanta

description.plain:
Russ continues to release his weekly singles/songs even after the new year. This is his 2nd song of 2016 which was released on January 13th.

Russ has been dropping only singles since his song “Kiki” was released (October 11th of 2014). This will make his 69th single since “Kiki” was released.

Since his release of his song “Got It Good” (released February 1st, 2015) he has not gone one week without releasing a single with the exception of one week where he released a music video for his song “Losin Control” and a week when he was out of town going to Philly, NYC, and other places for shows and to relax with friends.

He’s going this route in hopes that a song will blow up so his talent is exposed to everyone and will gain a larger audience.
Once he gets the attention he feels he deserves we should expect the singles to come less frequent and that he will began to release albums that will have everyone listening.



Every song has been produced, written, mixed, mastered, and engineered by Russ himself. Each song has also been free to download and his most popular songs are available to purchase on iTunes.

ALL MUSIC at DIEMON.COM

songs.title: Basement

description.plain:
Russ teams up with Jessie Reyez to deliver this emotional song about a real connection with someone that feels as though it came before he blew up.

This marks the first Russ song with a featured artist since “Keep On Goin'” featuring Bas, released on March 16, 2017.

songs.title: Begging You

description.plain:
“Begging You” is where Russ vents about the problems he has in his life, like his doubts and relationship status. He mentions issues he has with his father, his grandfathers death, and how he hasn’t been in love since he was putting out mixtapes.

In the chorus, Russ is asking someone to take his pain away. This person could very well be God. This song could be in the perspective of Russ praying, asking the Lord for help and to relieve him of his struggle.
